text:
A regional resource-cum-training centre was declared open at the office of the District Differently Abled Welfare Office in the city on Tuesday. The centre, sanctioned at a cost of Rs. 36 lakh by the State government, includes early intervention centres for children with autism and multiple disabilities and a day care centre for mentally ill persons. Medical officers would conduct assessment of differently abled persons at the centre for issue of national identity cards. The centre was declared open by T.P. Poonachi, Minister for Khadi and Village Industries, in the presence of R.Manoharan, Chief Government Whip,, K.S.Palanisamy, District Collector, N.Saminathan, District Differently Welfare Officer, and other elected representatives. Assistive devices worth Rs. 18.92 lakh were distributed among 563 beneficiaries from Tiruchi East, Tiruchi West, Manachanallur and Srirangam assembly constituencies on the occasion.

An evening in

memory of M.S.

The Aura, a city-based women’s forum, would host a dance programme, ‘Nrthyam Madhuram,’ by Radhika Shurajit and troupe to commemorate the centenary of the musical legend, M.S. Subbulakshmi, at Hotel Femina in the city at 6 p.m. on February 28. Tickets, priced at Rs.300, would be available at Hotel Femina and Hotel Sangam, according to a release.

Financial

aid given

Two persons were handed over financial assistance to the tune of Rs.45,000 from the District Welfare Fund. While Arjun of Thottiyam was given Rs.25,000 for treatment for his skin ailment, Krithika of Koppu village was given Rs.20,000 towards treatment for a heart ailment. Collector K.S.Palanisamy, who is also the chairman of the District Welfare Fund Committee, handed over the cheques to the beneficiaries.
title: Training centre opened
